alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pecos and eastern Jeff Davis Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles southeast of Balmorhea Lake, or 28 miles east of Fort Davis, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Pecos and eastern Jeff Davis Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
